Comments_List: Tips for being at COP24.
Logistical insights into attending COP 24 in Poland.
I gained some secondhand knowledge from other students who went to COP previous years, but the course was otherwise not useful.
Preparations for attending COP24.
Accurately set expectations for attending COP24
Helpful preparation for COP!
NA
this course was to prepare us (logistically) for COP

Work planning and implementation for major events/conferences
Time organisation
Engaging with conference logistics
Very helpful in organizing and planning for an International Conference such as the United Nations Climate Conference.
Well.
Medium. There was a lot of discussion which seemed basic and unnecessary but some insights were new and helpful.
This course was disappointing and did not leave me feeling any more prepared for COP than if I had not taken the course.
This class was helpful for preparing logistics for COP - however, I hoped it would provide some more specifics than it did.
While the class itself was a minimal commitment, by the time COP24 came around I felt adequately prepared based on discussions and planning  with classmates
They matched my expectations!
NA

I wish we covered a bit more in terms of specifics - there were things we were each working out individually instead of as a group (i.e. how to file for a reimbursement, what the per diem rate was, what a reasonable COP schedule looks like). The draft work plan was a useful exercise even if things changed so much it wasn't useful.
Very well.
Very helpful in navigating through the processes of attending the UNFCCC climate conference.
Perhaps more information on how to find documents, types of meetings (informal, inf-inf, coordination, plenaries). That information would've been useful in advance of going to COP.
Shorten the time and be more efficient with class time to get key information across.

Professors and TF available for questions, and the class had a nice atmosphere/environment. It could be improved by being a bit more formal - we met for about 30 minutes each time, and I would have been willing to meet for longer in order to have a more organized introduction to attending COP.

I benefitted most from listening to students who had already attended several COPs -- their advice was incredibly helpful. My only suggestion for the course would be to go through the UNFCCC website before COP to show students where to find schedules and negotiating documents.
I don't think that this course is very useful and question whether it should be offered/required at all.
see above.

The classes were very flexible and gave students opportunities to share their experiences or any concerns that they had, to build up a support system ahead of COP24, and to learn from each other as a class.
The course prepares students to  attend the climate summit and I would love to see more interaction with CDO on how students might maximizing such opportunities.
It's somewhat useful for preparing for COP.
Take this class if required to receive Yale funding, but keep your expectations low for what value it will bring you.
You have to be a self-starter / go-getter to organize your logistics for COP.
Be an active participant and come with questions!
NA
ask questions if something isn't covered, as there is a lot of expertise in one room.
A necessary preparatory class if you will be attending COP or any other major conference that the class is focused on.
Be prepared to take action in a timely manner.
